an11.22-29:4.1: “Mendicants, a cowherd with eleven factors can’t maintain and expand a herd of cattle.
an11.22-29:4.3: It’s when a cowherd doesn’t know form, is unskilled in characteristics, doesn’t pick out flies’ eggs, doesn’t dress wounds, doesn’t smoke out pests, doesn’t know the ford, doesn’t know when they’re satisfied, doesn’t know the trail, is not skilled in pastures, milks dry, and doesn’t show extra respect to the bulls who are fathers and leaders of the herd.
an11.22-29:4.4: A cowherd with these eleven factors can’t maintain and expand a herd of cattle.
an11.22-29:5.1: In the same way, a mendicant with eleven qualities can’t meditate observing impermanence in the eye …
